alert.note: Alert for Defiance; Fulton; Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 9:18PM EST until December 17 at 9:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Williams, Fulton and Defiance Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tiffin River at Stryker. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood waters begin to affect some farm buildings near Stryker and flood some secondary roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 11.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall to 11.3 feet and begin rising again Monday morning. It will rise to 12.5 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
